runs.comm: clips to midwicket as this is full and swings in a touch on middle.
slower ball, Finch is well fooled as his bottom hand flies off the handle. This was full and teasing outside off. He's far too early on the drive and the ball skews over midwicket
another slower ball, Warner's spotted it though and nudges it to square leg to get off the mark
full toss on off stump, Finch punches down the ground and they scurry forth for a single
112 kph, that's his fastest ball of the over. Full and just outside off, Warner was targeting a thump through the covers but doesn't connect. Deflection off the keeper for byes

oh, he seems to specialise in this kind of bowling. Good length ball grips the pitch and rips across Finch's outside edge as he defends. Ramdin's sharp behind the stumps, but Finch's backfoot is firmly grounded
flighted on off stump, pushed down to long-on
sets himself up outside leg stump to drill the tossed up delivery on off stump, but finds mid-off
stays leg side and cuts the flatter ball off middle and leg. Can't beat point

this sails over long-off! They've definitely made a gameplan for Badree and it seems it's already beginning to bear fruit. Tossed up on middle and leg, but Finch was waiting outside leg and swung cleanly
flatter ball on middle and leg, Finch makes room and cuts him behind point. Gorgeous stroke

and again, this time in front of point. Australia take the first round against spin! Badree hasn't cooked up a counter to Finch moving leg side and offers a quicker ball on middle. Finch slaps it away off the back foot
point dives to his left but it's placed just wide of him. Full delivery invites him forward and the width allows him to slash through the gap
slower ball on and around the stumps, pushes to mid-on
offers up a full toss on off stump and Warner thumps it through extra cover. This pitch is a beauty
fullish and outside off, Warner is on the back foot but the ball skids through his defences
nudged into the covers off the back foot
slow on middle, Finch waits for it and plays with soft hands and an angled bat. The single though does not present itself
gets just a hint of turn on middle and off, Warner pushes square on the off side
keeps leg side of the ball, which is flighted not too far outside off. Warner hoists him over the covers. Marvellous striking this
slows it up and keeps it on the stumps, pushes down the ground
slog sweep across the line fetches the first wicket. Samuels persists with flighting it and invites Finch to go for the heave over the leg side. Misses completely and has his off stump pegged back
fires it full and down the leg side
full and just outside off, lunges forward to defend
clipped to midwicket and Gayle is incredibly stiff in moving to his left. Easy single
fullish on middle, keeps Watson to a defensive push.
drives just to the left of mid-off and sneaks a single. West Indies need to be a lot more urgent in the field, even if they're worried about the big hits and hugging to the circle
lovely! Warner was looking to carve this behind point, but the wrong 'un skids on and beats him
this time he rocks back and pounds the shortish ball in front of point. He's not getting too much off the pitch and Warner has taken note of it. Excellent footwork
this one slides down the leg side and Warner cannot connect with the pull

this is the skidder and Warner's bat speed is just not quick enough! Might have stayed a touch low too as Badree targets middle. The batsman was making room to cut, but fails. Has a satisfied little smile as he jogs over to his fielders to celebrate

big lbw appeal against Maxi the new batsman! That was very close as Badree tosses it up on middle and the batsman was looking to hit across the line through midwicket. Gets hit low on the front pad, but the umpire thinks this was going down leg
flights the carrom ball and gets a leading edge while he seeks midwicket. The ball lobs up but goes too far to the left of the bowler
flighted on off, pushed back down the pitch
grips into the pitch and this rips in at him. Watson has no clue what this is and plods forward to block down the wrong line

he's missed the stumps on the first attempt, but he's broken it on the second and Watson's back foot had not moved back into safety! That's a major brain fade! Narine tosses the one that spins the other way and Watson gropes for it. His back foot was bang on the line and he seemed completely unaware of it. To the point of giving Ramdin a second bite at the cherry
flighted on middle, he strides forward to block
tossed up outside off, driven with an angled bat to point to complete a wicket-maiden
this one drifts in on middle and is clipped away through midwicket
goes forward and uses the width on it to drive in front of point
big inside edge onto the back pad stifles the appeal midway. Slog sweep to no avail
keeps it nice and ful and cramps him up. Defended into the leg side
rocks back and cuts this flatter ball to point
there's Australia's counterpunch! Bailey gets down on one knee and wallops this clear over the midwicket boundary
worked away to deep midwicket as he reads the one turning in off the pitch
tucked away just in front of square leg and Bailey's looking for a suicidal second! But Maxwell is wary of the danger and sent him back. A desperate dive saves the Aussie captain

slip dives to his left and fails to net this. Narine slowed it down and gets a little bit more bounce and turn than Maxi expected. Pushes at it after setting himself up outside leg stump and gets a genuine edge.
flighted on middle, worked away through square leg
waits on the back foot and tapes the flatter ball on off to point
flighted on middle and off, nudged towards deep square leg
his efforts to outsmart the batsmen backfires spectacularly. Slower ball pitched too far up and outside off, Maxi leans into a solid crunch through the covers
length ball with considerable room outside off and Maxi's slammed this over long-on. The short boundaries on the leg side are working their magic
another cart to the boundary. This is fuller and just outside off, but Maxi doesn't care. Plonks his front foot forward and swipes him to the square leg boundary
swats the fuller ball outside off to deep midwicket. Slower ball from Sammy again
short and wide outside off is slapped to the sweeper
fullish and angled in at him, Maxi was targeting midwicket again and gets an inside edge onto his back pad
sharp turn from outside off as Bailey backs away and flat bats to long-off
pitches it short and Maxi shuffles across and pulls to deep square leg

skips down the track and he's picked out the man at short midwicket! Samuels had seen the batsman advancing and adjusted his length, but it was still not too threatening. But Bailey has shoveled it straight into the hands of his opposite number
waits on it and dabs fine of short third man. Using the bowler's pace there
Shortish and just outside off, Maxi makes room outside leg and cuts well in front of point. Santokie is the man partolling the boundary and he's too slow to stop it.
slog swept way into the stands behind midwicket. Took it from off stump and a full-blooded swing has massacred this
fullish and outside off, Hodge drives just wide of mid-off
slower ball well outside off, but Maxi's decided that side of the ground is of no use. Swipes it wide of long-on and his power is more than enough.
fullish delivery, in the slot to be slogged over midwicket and that's what he wants to do. Doesn't connect
full on off stump, pushed into the covers
way wide of off stump, but Maxi's tap to point prevents the ump from calling it a wide
low full toss on off stump, whipped to long-on

he had to reach for this and it seemed like Badree had fooled him. Maxi was making room outside leg and so the bowler tossed it up wide of off stump. But somehow he connects and has hit it well enough to clear extra cover
reverse sweep, but he's hit it straight to short third man

picks up the length ball and swings it to deep midwicket, where Bravo runs forward and secures an important catch! It's to the longer part of the ground he goes for and was backing himself to clear the boundary. And in current form, I'm not too sure too many people could blame him
flighted on and around middle, pushed down to long-on. Hodge was looking for two but is sent back
flighted on middle and this gets the leading edge as Faulkner was looking to go on side.
wrong 'un and it hasn't been picked. Faulkner was patiently waiting for it to pitch and turn and then suddenly has to put bat in front of his stumps
slower ball just outside off, steered down to deep third man
drifting onto the pads and Faulkner has turned it well fine of short fine leg. Clever stroke
fullish and outside off, strides forward and drives but gets it off the bottom of the bat
low full toss outside off, bunted to short cover
fullish and angled in on off stump, strides forward with an angled face and picks up a single in front of point
slower, length ball on off stump. Dabbed just behind point
flights it on middle, worked away to deep midwicket for a couple
quick and flat outside off, he's on the back foot and punches to long-on
this turns away from the bat and Faulkner strides forward and dabs through to deep cover
cramps him up with a flighted ball that turns into him. Hodge tries to steer to third man but has no room to do so
kept on a good length on off stump, defended
nudged in front of midwicket and Sammy isn't able to pick up the ball and pose a threat
seeks the block hole just outside off, pushed down to long-off
drilled down the ground and Russell does well getting his left hand to it on his followthrough. Wrings it while he returns to his mark
low full toss on middle, Hodge clips it handsomely to deep midwicket
oh dear, this is a beamer that moves in at the batsman too. Faulkner jerks his head away and it beats the keeper as well to scurry on for five no-balls
141kph, goes nice and full just outside off and is thumped to the left of long-off
pushes the fuller ball down the ground to long-on and they rush through for a couple. Good running
low full toss on leg stump and Hodge has dismissed it to the long leg boundary. Easy put away but it was so efficiently done
slower ball on middle, clipped towards deep midwicket and the bowler himself hustles after it and his efforts are rewarded as the batsmen settle for a single
nudged to long-on as Santokie delivers an offcutter which grips a little
fullish on middle, kept out
122 kph, think that might be his fastest ball today. Fullish and just outside off, steered to deep point
110kph, very full just outside off and this gets a thick outside edge. No chance for Ramdin and Hodge was savvy enough not to move his back foot
good length ball outisde off, tapped in front of point for a single
looks for the wide yorker and Hodge benefits from an inside edge to the fine leg fence. Hodge was moving around in the crease and Bravo was looking to outsmart him
another full toss over waist and Hodge has creamed this over midwicket. Muscled away
full and wide outside off, Hodge opens the face and slices this to deep cover. Lovely shot
low full toss angled in at him, Faulkner was looking to whip it away and gets an inside edge onto pad. Squirts away behind point for a single
wanted to lap it, but Bravo bowls a slower one outside off. Hodge is good enough to recover from his premeditated stroke and push into the covers
moves across to open up the leg side, but gets more of an inside edge as he tries a swipe. Bravo races after it as it skews away towards midwicket
short ball outside off, Hodge goes for the pull but he's mistimed it. Smith at long-on mops up
good length ball, skids on just outside off. Hodge plays against the turn and his pull doesn't connect
gets a little bit of extra bounce as he was backing away to cut. The thick outside edge lobs towards short third man but falls short of Gayle
appreciable turn into him and Faulkner can only pick it off the pitch, turned away behind square leg

oh dear! He's gone for a premeditated reverse sweep and has lost his leg stump! Narine, as he often does, claims a crucial wicket in the death. This was too full for the shot but he goes through with it. The ball sneaks between his legs and lights up those LEDs
plonks his bat in front of pad and nudges towards midwicket
slower short ball and Haddin, by virtue of going for the pull too early, doesn't connect. The keeper doesn't glove it either

he seemed to had fluffed it, but he threw himself back and completes the catch with a whole lot of flair! This was full with a bit of width attached to it and Faulkner looked for the inside out smash over cover. His slower pace doesn't allow for much timing on it and this goes up high than long. Bravo had raced up from long-off and had almost overran it. The ball pops out of his reverse cup, but he had his eyes on the ball all the way and just propels himself off his feet in a full-length dive to catch it behind him
length ball on off stump, thumped to deep midwicket
what a shot! Moved outside off and simply lofted it over the midwicket ropes. Such rich timing.
fires it way wide of off stump and Ramdin actually did well to get a hand to it
fullish and just outside off, drilled to long-off
clears his front leg and slaps the fuller ball down the ground. Pulled back just inside the boundary rope
dropped. Makes room outside leg and slap this to the man at cover. Santokie dives to his left but isn't able to hold on
bowls one full and way wide of off stump. Think he was worried about Starc targeting those short on-side boundaries
another one, length ball pushed way outside off stump
wonderfully bowled. He knew the batsman was just intent on swinging, so he rolls his fingers over the ball. Starc goes for it but he plays down the wrong line
tonks the length ball straight down the ground, but long-on runs to his right and Russell pouches a lovely catch.
low full toss on leg stump, whipped away to long leg and Haddin is off strike
skips down the track and lobs it over the bowler. There's a misfield by the man running in from the covers and it almost reaches the long-off boundary if not for the captain Darren Sammy
he was backing away on the leg side and Bravo, in an attempt to follow him, bowls it even further wide.
carves this inside out and the ball thuds into the extra cover advertising boards. This was full and on middle and leg stump, but Haddin had made room again and has timed this exceedingly well
